title: Aperture
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20141016154525/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Terminology](http://web.archive.org/web/20141016154525/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Terminology) : Aperture**

An "aperture" is a constricted opening of a [glyph](http://web.archive.org/web/20141016154525/http:/typophile.com/wiki/glyph). For example, the lowercase "e" has an aperture at 4 o'clock. This aperture is relatively small in some fonts (such as Avant Garde) and much larger (or more open) in others (such as Frutiger). It is widely believed that a relatively large aperture helps [readability](http://web.archive.org/web/20141016154525/http:/typophile.com/wiki/readability).

See also [Counter](http://web.archive.org/web/20141016154525/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Counter).
